questions.title: Did you receive a flu vaccine this winter season?
comment: Note that the years will need to be changed each year.
description: Why are we asking this?
We would like to be able to work out how much protection the vaccine gives. We would also like to find out  if there is some protection from vaccines received in previous years.
How should I answer it?
Answer yes if you received the vaccine last year (during the autumn/winter of 2010-2011).

questions.title: When were you vaccinated against this flu season?
What were your reasons for getting a seasonal influenza vaccination this year?

option_1.text: I belong to a risk group (e.g, pregnant, over 65, underlying health condition, etc)

option_12.text: The COVID-19 context encouraged me to get influenza vaccination this year 12

option_2.text: Vaccination decreases my risk of getting the flu

option_3.text: Vaccination decreases the risk of spreading the flu to others

option_5.text: It was recommended in my workplace/school

option_6.text: The vaccine was readily available and vaccine administration was convenient

option_8.text: I don’t want to miss work/school

questions.title: What were your reasons for NOT getting a seasonal influenza vaccination this year?

option_1.text: I am planning to be vaccinated but haven’t been yet

option_2.text: I haven’t been offered the vaccine

option_3.text: I don’t belong to a risk group

option_4.text: It is better to build your own natural immunity against influenza

option_5.text: I doubt that the influenza vaccine is effective

option_16.text: Because of COVID-19 pandemic, I avoid seing doctors or going to the pharmacy

option_17.text: I am afraid that influenza vaccine would increase my risk of getting COVID-19

option_18.text: Other reason linked with COVID-19 (open field)

option_7.text: I don’t think I am likely to get the flu

option_8.text: I believe that influenza vaccine can cause influenza

option_9.text: I am worried that the vaccine is not safe or will cause illness or other adverse events

option_11.text: The vaccine is not readily available for me

option_12.text: The vaccine is not free of charge

option_14.text: Although my doctor recommended a vaccine, I did not get one

questions.title: Have you received a COVID-19 vaccine (since December 2020)?
description: Why are we asking this?
We would like to be able to work out how much protection the vaccine gives.
How should I answer it?
Report yes, if you received a COVID-19 vaccine this season (since December 2020). If you get vaccinated after filling in this questionnaire, please return to this and update your answer.

questions.title: Which COVID-19 vaccine did you receive?

moderna.text: COVID-19 Vaccine Moderna™, from Moderna laboratory

questions.title: How many doses of this vaccine did you receive?
description: Why are we asking this?
We would like to be able to work out how much protection a complete vaccination scheme gives.
How should I answer it?

Report the number of doses you received (which corresponds to the number of time you were vaccinated against COVID-19 this season). If you get another dose after filling in this questionnaire, please return to this and update your answer.

questions.title: When did you receive your first injection of a vaccine against COVID-19 (since December 2020)?
description: Why are we asking this?
Knowing when people are vaccinated tells us how well the vaccination program is being carried out.
How should I answer it?

Please try and answer as accurately as possible. If you do not know the precise date, please give your best estimate. For instance, you might remember the month, then try and remember if it was at the beginning or the end of the month. Were there any significant events (e.g. a holiday or a birthday) that might help jog your memory?

questions.title: When did you receive your second injection of a vaccine against COVID-19 (since December 2020)?
description: Why are we asking this?
Knowing when people are vaccinated tells us how well the vaccination program is being carried out.
How should I answer it?

Please try and answer as accurately as possible. If you do not know the precise date, please give your best estimate. For instance, you might remember the month, then try and remember if it was at the beginning or the end of the month. Were there any significant events (e.g. a holiday or a birthday) that might help jog your memory?

questions.title: What were your reasons for getting a COVID-19 vaccination? (Select all options that apply)
description: Why are we asking this?
We would like to know why some people get the vaccine, and other don’t get it.
How should I answer it?
Please select all the answers who mattered to take your decision.

recommended_by_pha.text: The vaccination is recommended by public health authorities

belong_atrisk.text: I belong to a group who is at risk of complications in case of COVID-19 (over 65, underlying health condition, obesity, etc.)

work_contact_atrisk.text: I work in close contact with people at risk of complications in case of COVID-19 (working in a nursing home, health staff…)

decrease_my_risk.text: Vaccination decreases my risk of getting COVID-19

decrease_spread.text: Vaccination decreases the risk of spreading COVID-19 to others

recommended_work.text: It was recommended in my workplace/school

availability.text: The vaccine was readily available and vaccine administration was convenient

miss_work.text: I don’t want to miss work/school
